item.description:
The low for Tuesday night is 28 degrees. Is that going to stop us from kicking some butt in frisbee? Nay, I say! Nay! Frisbee lives on! A little below freezing weather isn't going to stop us! We will fight onward and upward through the spring. Snow will cower in fear at our greatness! I refuse to be beaten by a mere 28 degrees. It's going to take a lot more degrees than that!

I love exclamation points!

You got all that? SO. We'll meet around 7 pm on Cambridge Common (outside Harvard Square), throw the discs around for a while and learn each other's names and jolly red faces, then play ultimate starting around 7:30. All are welcome, regardless of skill level -- just as long as you want to have fun and bring all your inner sunshine to the field! And maybe some heat, that would be great.

We usually call it quits between 9:30 and 10, but considering the weather, who knows how long we'll actually last. If someone turns into a big ice cube out there, we probably will be accommodating and call it a night so they can thaw somewhere nice and warm. Somewhere like Uno's or Tealuxe for warm beverages, snacks or (brr) ice cream -- everyone is encouraged to come along. It's really great to get to know some of the people we've been playing frisbee with in the dark. Especially YOU !

See you there!
- Chris (the fat one.)

781 301 1791 (Add me to your address book so I will feel cool and loved.)
item.name: Frisbee and Freezing on the Common
